question: Which country houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site and the landmark castle and palace complex "Buda Castle"?
explanation: Hungary houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site and the landmark castle and palace complex "Buda Castle". Buda Castle is the historical castle and palace complex of the Hungarian kings in Budapest. It was first completed in 1265, but the massive Baroque palace today occupying most of the site was built between 1749 and 1769. The castle now houses the Hungarian National Gallery and The Budapest History Museum.
